titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Cornelius Desosway receipt fragment 1981.008
titlestmt.author: Nicholas Pavlik
titlestmt.sponsor: This collection was originally processed and described as part of the project, "Uncovering the Secrets of Brooklyn's 19th Century Past: Creation to Consolidation," funded by the Council on Library and Information Resources, with additional support from The Gladys Krieble Delmas Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2024-07-19 18:02:48 +0000.
profiledesc.langusage: Description is written in: English, Latin script.

did.abstract: Handwritten fragment of a receipt, dated 1820, between Cornelius Desosway and an individual residing in New York City whose first name is Gerardus.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Source and date of acquisition unknown. Formally accessioned in 1981.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: This collection consists of a single document.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Cornelius Desosway receipt fragment, 1820, 1981.008; Brooklyn Public Library, Center for Brooklyn History.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: This collection was rehoused and the finding aid revised by Dee Bowers in 2024.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Handwritten fragment of a receipt, dated 1820, between Cornelius Desosway and an individual residing in New York City whose first name is Gerardus. The surname of the second individual is not included on the fragment.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: This item is in the public domain.
